tech_news.title: Xbox chief Phil Spencer is leaving Microsoft - The Verge
tech_news.description: Phil Spencer, head of Xbox and Microsoft Gaming CEO, is leaving Microsoft. Xbox president Sarah Bond is also leaving Microsoft.

tech_news.title: Bounty Pack 2 Vault Card - Borderlands | Official Website
tech_news.description: Venture into the heart of the mountains in this paid DLC coming February 26.

tech_news.title: Meta’s metaverse leaves virtual reality - TechCrunch
tech_news.description: Meta said it's shifting focus for Horizon Worlds to be "almost exclusively mobile" and that it will separate its Quest VR platform from the virtual world.

tech_news.title: Three Upcoming Apple Products Seemingly Spotted in macOS 26.3 Code - MacRumors
tech_news.description: macOS 26.3 hints at Apple's rumored lower-cost MacBook, and two new Studio Display models, according to Macworld's Filipe Espósito.  ...

tech_news.title: CarPlay just got a big upgrade, and iOS 26.4 delivers even more - 9to5Mac
tech_news.description: iOS 26 brought some of the biggest CarPlay changes in years, and now iOS 26.4 goes even further, revealing a refocus by Apple on CarPlay.

tech_news.title: Climate Physicists Face the Ghosts in Their Machines: Clouds - Quanta Magazine
tech_news.description: The planet is getting hotter, but one factor in particular makes it hard to tell just how hot it will get. Physicists and computer scientists are racing to solve the problem of clouds.

tech_news.title: OpenAI Plans to Price Smart Speaker at $200 to $300, as AI Device Team Takes Shape - The Information

tech_news.title: Nintendo turned its biggest flop into an expensive, uncomfortable novelty - The Verge
tech_news.description: Nintendo’s new Virtual Boy accessory for the Switch and Switch 2 is much like the original: an interesting, awkward, and uncomfortable novelty.

tech_news.title: Ubisoft CEO Explains Three-Year Plan to Revamp Game Publisher Through New ‘Creative House’ Strategy, More Than $200 Million in Cost Reductions (EXCLUSIVE) - Variety
tech_news.description: “Assassin’s Creed” publisher Ubisoft is trying to emerge from a rocky few years. CEO Yves Guillemot breaks down the new strategy for success.
